column6: With direct line responsibility for key members of the Executive team, the CE role leads Dstl as a Trading Fund, delivering value for money science and technology-based support and advice to customers.  This includes getting the best out of suppliers and partners, and balancing short-term delivery with long-term capability.  The CE role is ultimately responsible for ensuring: the financial viability of Dstl; that customers are satisfied; and that the Dstl workforce is suitably engaged and rewarded for their contributions.

This role is a key member of the Executive and ensures that Dstl can successfully deliver its operational programme through the effective and efficient support of the core infrastructure and enabling services for Dstl including Estates, Security, SHEF, Resilience, Business Administration Services, Knowledge and Information Services and Commercial Services.

This role works with all the key senior internal and external stakeholders to define the requirements and formulate and deliver the MoD’s Science and Technology (S&T) Research portfolio for the Chief Scientific Adviser (CSA).

Responsible for the development and implementation of People Strategy, including organisational culture and behaviours, which sets out the people focused aspects of the Dstl corporate plan identifying how Dstl staff are resourced, managed, developed and rewarded to enable business success.  Also responsible for relationships with Trade Unions and wider Civil Service Human Resources.

This role is a key member of the Dstl Executive Team and Main Board (and audit committee?) and is accountable for the robust and rigorous financial control, performance and financial management of DSTL. The role also provides high level strategic financial advice to drive the business forward and ensure the business makes the right decisions.

The Director of Corporate Strategy and Deputy Chief Executive role is a key member of the Executive team. This role sets the direction for the organisation, managing the regular business strategy planning calendar, providing strategic insights and analysis and other business input in to key strategic decisions, ensuring that Dstl is governed properly and following necessary legislation, regulation and procedures, and ensuring appropriate communications with external and internal audiences.

This role leads, communicates and drives forward the changes in long term workforce capability requirements,  defining how the workforce will operate and the environment in which it will work  in order to ensure the future success of the business, involving all key stakeholders and making sure there is  no or minimum disruption to the delivery programme and customers.
This role ensures that Dstl delivers its operational programme of work safely, to the appropriate time cost and quality levels, and in a well planned and controlled manner.

Responsible for  programme formulation and the relationship with MoD and other Government Department stakeholders, academia and industry within the CBR, Human Dimention and Medical Sciences, Futures and Innovation, Security, Cyber and Influence, Counter Terrorism and CDE domains.

Responsible for formulation and delivery of MoD's S&T programme and for managing relationships with MoD stakeholders, academia and industry, within the land, air, maritime, C4I, ISTAR, weapons and  strategy & capability programme areas.
The role  is responsible for ensuring Dstl’s S&T investment delivers maximum impact on Defence and Security and for ensuring positive relationships with Dstl’s customers.

The role is responsible for ensuring that our work is structured and managed in an efficient manner and that it delivers real tangible benefits to our customers. It is also responsible for the roll-out of programme management across Dstl.
